Package level

Class Layer<T>

java.lang.Object
level.Layer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of objects stored in the layer, e.g., Actor, Item, Tile.
public class Layer<T> extends Object
The Layer class represents a layer in a game level, containing a grid of objects such as actors, items, or tiles. The class is generic, allowing for different types of objects to be stored in a single layer. It includes methods for populating the layer, writing the layer to a data structure, managing game elements like traps, and linking game elements such as traps with levers.

  • Constructor Details

    • Layer

      public Layer(int width, int height, int timeLimit, String[][] layerBlock)
      Constructs a new Layer with specified dimensions, time limit, and initial data.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the layer.
      height - The height of the layer.
      timeLimit - The time limit for the layer, used in time-based game levels.
      layerBlock - The initial data to populate the layer.

  • Method Details

    • populateLayer

      public void populateLayer(String[][] layerBlock)
      Populates the layer with objects based on the provided data block.
      Parameters:
      layerBlock - A 2D array of strings representing the initial data for the layer.

    • createObject

      public T createObject(String key, int x, int y)
      Creates an object based on a key and its position. The method determines the type of object (Actor, Item, Tile) based on the key and creates it.
      Parameters:
      key - The key representing the object to be created.
      x - The x-coordinate of the object in the layer.
      y - The y-coordinate of the object in the layer.
      Returns:
      The created object, cast to the generic type T.

    • writeLayer

      public String[][] writeLayer()
      Converts the current state of the layer into a 2D String array. Each element in the layer is represented by its key. This method is useful for serializing or visualizing the layer's current state.
      Returns:
      A 2D String array representing the current state of the layer.

    • writeLayerNoPickedUp

      public String[][] writeLayerNoPickedUp()
      Converts the current state of the layer into a 2D String array, excluding picked-up items. This is similar to writeLayer, but it replaces keys of picked-up items with a placeholder. Useful for scenarios where the visibility of picked-up items needs to be toggled.
      Returns:
      A 2D String array representing the current state of the layer, without showing picked-up items.

    • getKey

      public String getKey(T element)
      Retrieves the key of an element in the layer using reflection. This method uses reflection to call the getKey method on the element, if it exists.
      Parameters:
      element - The element for which the key is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The key of the element as a String, or "##" if the element is null.

    • getTraps

      public ArrayList<tile.Trap> getTraps()
      Retrieves a list of all traps present in the layer. This method scans the layer and collects all elements that are instances of the Trap class.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList<Trap> containing all the traps found in the layer.

    • checkPickedItems

      public ArrayList<item.Item> checkPickedItems()
      Checks and returns a list of all items in the layer. This method is used to compile a list of all items currently present in the layer, which can be used to update an inventory or check the state of the items.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList<Item> containing all the items in the layer.

    • linkTraps

      public void linkTraps(ArrayList<tile.Trap> trapList)
      Links traps with their corresponding game buttons based on matching numbers. This method establishes a connection between each trap and its associated game button, allowing for the game logic to interactively control traps via buttons.
      Parameters:
      trapList - A list of traps to be linked with game buttons.

    • getObject

      public T getObject(int x, int y)
      Retrieves an object from the layer at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the object.
      y - The y-coordinate of the object.
      Returns:
      The object at the specified coordinates.

    • getData

      public T[][] getData()
      Gets the entire data of the layer as a 2D array.
      Returns:
      The 2D array representing the layer's data.

    • getTile

      public tile.Tile getTile(int x, int y)
      Retrieves a tile object from the layer at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the tile.
      y - The y-coordinate of the tile.
      Returns:
      The tile at the specified coordinates.

      y - The y-coordinate of the actor.
      Returns:
      The actor at the specified coordinates.

      y - The y-coordinate of the item.
      Returns:

    • setTile

      public void setTile(int x, int y, tile.Tile tile)

      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate where the tile will be set.
      y - The y-coordinate where the tile will be set.
      tile - The tile to be set at the specified coordinates.

      Sets a new time limit for the layer.
      Parameters:
      timeLimit - The new time limit to be set.

    • getEntity

      public T getEntity(int x, int y)
      Retrieves an entity (of type T) from the layer at the specified coordinates. This method is a general form of getObject and can be used for any type T.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the entity.
      y - The y-coordinate of the entity.
      Returns:
      The entity at the specified coordinates.

    • setData

      public void setData(T[][] data)
      Sets the data for the layer. This method allows for updating the entire data array of the layer with a new set of data. It can be used to replace the current state of the layer with a new one, represented by the provided 2D array.
      Parameters:
      data - The new data array to set for the layer.
